Class Task

java.lang.Object
com.example.examplefeature.Task
@Entity public class Task extends Object
Represents a task entity stored in the database.

Each Task has a unique identifier, a textual description, a creation date, and an optional due date.

This class is annotated with JPA annotations for ORM mapping and includes validation logic to ensure the description length does not exceed DESCRIPTION_MAX_LENGTH.

      The maximum allowed length of the task description.
      See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Task

      protected Task()
      Default constructor required by JPA.

      Protected to prevent direct instantiation outside JPA.

    • Task

      public Task(String description, Instant creationDate)
      Creates a new Task with the specified description and creation date.
      Parameters:
      description - the description of the task; must not exceed DESCRIPTION_MAX_LENGTH characters
      creationDate - the timestamp when the task was created; must not be null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the description length exceeds DESCRIPTION_MAX_LENGTH

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public @Nullable Long getId()
      Returns the unique identifier of this task.
      Returns:
      the task ID, or null if not yet persisted

    • getDescription

      Returns the textual description of this task.
      Returns:
      the task description

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(String description)
      Updates the description of this task.
      Parameters:
      description - the new description; must not exceed DESCRIPTION_MAX_LENGTH characters
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the description length exceeds DESCRIPTION_MAX_LENGTH

    • getCreationDate

      public Instant getCreationDate()

      Returns the due date of this task, if any.
      Returns:
      the due date, or null if not set

    • setDueDate

      public void setDueDate(@Nullable LocalDate dueDate)
      Sets or updates the due date for this task.
      Parameters:
      dueDate - the new due date; can be null to remove the due date

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this task to another object for equality.

      Two tasks are considered equal if they have the same non-null identifier.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare with
      Returns:
      true if the other object is a Task with the same ID; false otherwise

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code for this task.

      The hash code is based only on the class type, not the task ID, because IDs are assigned after persistence and should not affect the hash code of transient objects.

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      a constant hash code based on the class
